title: Ticket #4804: Managed condor_submit transforms
description:
NOTE: This ticket abandoned as we ultimately implemented the functionality in #5885 instead

We live with two kinds of wrappers in our lives:

  • condor_submit wrappers: The sysadmin wants to set some sort of non-trivial transformation for the user's job (i.e. setting accounting_group to something that can't be done with SUBMIT_ATTRS).
  • Executable wrapper: Think dmtcp_shim or parrot_run; these are put in front of the executable; typically, arguments are added, new environment variables are inserted, and additional files are transferred.

These are ugly, but a common pattern. We should provide a built-in mechanism for transforms.

We are considering two possibilities: one based upon the job router functionality, and a second that would introduce some simple schedd knobs.

Option 1 - JobRouter based solution

It turns out, HTCondor already has a transform mechanism for job ClassAds - job routes! I propose we use job routes (as currently configured -- although I want to make it less miserable to add new routes separately); the user can add a list of these to their submit files to apply the route to their job. For example: 

features = route1, route2, route3

where routeX is the name of the route. These are applied in order. Further:

  1. If the route's requirements expression evalautes to error, then the condor_submit fails.
  2. If the route requirement evaluates to false, then the route is not applied and the next one is considered.
  3. If the route requirement evaluates to true, the route is applied.

The idea is that something like: 

features = DMTCP
would do all the client transforms to submit the job with the dmtcp_shim.

A configuration variable, DEFAULT_FEATURES, would specify the features to apply to all jobs by default. This would give sysadmins a mechanism for setting things like accounting_group.

[Per usual, this only applies to condor_submit-based jobs; support for other clients. JobRouter or python bindings would have to come later.]

Option 2 - Simple Schedd Knob solution

The thinking here is we would have some simple schedd config knobs to handle common transformation situations, like "insert this attribute into every incoming ad". 

ON_SUBMIT_SET_XXX =
ON_SUBMIT_SET_EVAL_XXX =
ON_SUBMIT_SET_DEFAULT_XXX =
ON_SUBMIT_SET_EVAL_DEFAULT_XXX =

ON_SUBMIT_NOTREADY_STATE =
remarks:
2015-Feb-25 16:02:27 by bbockelm:
We found another use case for this:

The intensity frontier would like to prioritize resource provisioning. They have three classes of resources:

  • Owned CPUs at FNAL
  • Owned CPUs at select collaboration universities.
  • The rest of OSG

For FNAL CPUs, they'd like to provision glideins instantly; for university CPUs, they want to provision after the job has been in queue for 2 hours; for the rest of OSG, 4 hours.

However, in order to implement this scheduling or provisioning policy, we need to take queue date into account; this currently has a second-level granularity and will basically break auto-clustering.

Hence, we would like to be able to implement a submit feature which quantizes the QDate with an eval_set and copies it into a separate attribute. Hence, all jobs submitted during the same hour will possibly be in the same auto-cluster.

We would not like to use attribute rounding for this feature as we don't want to change the QDate itself; it's used in too many places in HTCondor.

2015-Mar-04 16:06:39 by bbockelm:
Another use case:

CMS has group information in an external service (could be a flat file, could be a web service call). We would like to use this group information for provisioning and matchmaking information.

Concretely, we want to be able to use the fact that user bbockelm is in group nebraska and send pilots to site Nebraska which will run only jobs in this group (assuming site Nebraska is interested in prioritizing this group).

We could put a list of all users in the group in the glidein's start expression: 

START = $(START) && ((Owner=?="bbockelm") || (Owner=?= "joe") || ...)

However, this would get tedious at a site like FNAL which may have >1,000 users in a given group.

Instead, we would like the group information calculated at submit time; suppose we put this in an job attribute called GroupName. Then, the start expression would be: 

START = $(START) && (GroupName =?= "nebraska")

This is scalable from the matchmaking and administrative POV.

2015-Apr-08 15:28:53 by bbockelm:
Discussion from today's OSG/HTCondor call:
  1. This gets assigned to Jaime, but he's got a handful of other items in the priority queue.
  2. This needs to be moved from submit utilities into the schedd.
  3. Transform logic probably needs to be extracted from JobRouter and made stand-alone.

2016-Apr-13 13:58:51 by tpdownes:
This is very similar to LIGO request #5613.

I don't see LIGO presently having a large need for users to specify the transformation. I agree with the conclusion that integrating the logic into the scheedd makes more sense than adding extra "distance" between a .sub file and its corresponding ClassAd.

I'd really like to see this make it in for 8.6 at least at the fairly simple level described in #5613. I am happy to do LIGO's transformation logic entirely in the Python bindings.
